Rule.NonCompliantComment: Unnecessary authentication and authorization modules are enabled.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable unused authentication and authorization modules by commenting out their LoadModule directives.
Rule.Correction: Manual review required; edit httpd.conf to comment out unused auth modules.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The log configuration module is not enabled, which may lead to misconfigured logging.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable the log_config module by ensuring its LoadModule directive is present.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: WebDAV modules are enabled, increasing the risk of unauthorized file manipulation.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable the WebDAV modules by commenting out their LoadModule directives.
Rule.Correction: sed -i 's/^LoadModule dav_module/#LoadModule dav_module/' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf; sed -i 's/^LoadModule dav_fs_module/#LoadModule dav_fs_module/' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The status module is enabled, which can expose sensitive server performance information.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable the mod_status module by commenting out its LoadModule directive.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The autoindex module is enabled, which may expose directory listings.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable the mod_autoindex module by commenting out its LoadModule directive.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Unnecessary proxy modules are enabled, increasing the attack surface.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable proxy modules by commenting out their LoadModule directives.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The user directories module is enabled, which may allow access to user home directories.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable the mod_userdir module by commenting out its LoadModule directive.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The info module is enabled, which can expose sensitive server configuration details.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable the mod_info module by commenting out its LoadModule directive.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The basic and digest authentication modules are enabled, which are considered insecure.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable the mod_auth_basic and mod_auth_digest modules by commenting out their LoadModule directives.
Rule.Correction: sed -i 's/^LoadModule auth_basic_module/#LoadModule auth_basic_module/' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf; sed -i 's/^LoadModule auth_digest_module/#LoadModule auth_digest_module/' /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf
